discipline.ja: ものづくり技術（機械・電気電子・化学工学）

paper_title.en: High-Capacity Multi-Stage Operation of Polarization-Diversity Silicon Photonics 8 x 8 Optical Switch

description.en: For practical and wide use of optical switches, cascadability and high throughput are of great significance. We demonstrate up to 8-stage cascaded operation of a polarization independent silicon photonics 8 x 8 optical switch where 11-channel 32/44-Gbaud DP-16QAM signals are loaded up on all the paths in a cyclic way. The results verify that the 8 x 8 switch is capable of offering a throughput of 48.2 Tb/s with a wall-plug energy efficiency of 0.37 pJ/bit. Using an additional optical module with the characteristics equivalent to the 8 x 8 switch, 9-stage cascaded operation is also emulated. The successful performance observed in these experiments promises the realization of optical switch fabrics with higher port counts by arranging the 8 x 8 switches in a multi-folded Clos network.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF LIGHTWAVE TECHNOLOGY

paper_title.en: Effect of Crosstalk on the Operation Bandwidth of Silicon Photonics 8 × 8 Optical Switch

description.en: We evaluated bandwidth of a silicon-photonics 8 × 8 switch for 21.5-Gbaud dual-polarization (DP) QPSK signals and 12-Gbaud DP-16QAM signals. A model of the switch to estimate bandwidth was also presented. The measured bandwidth of the 8 × 8 switch operating in 8-stage cascaded condition was in good agreement with the estimation.

publisher.en: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the 2018 Photonics in Switching and Computing, PSC 2018

paper_title.en: Fully-Loaded and Cascaded Operation of Polarization-Diversity 8 x 8 Silicon Photonics Optical Switch with 11-ch x 32/44-Gbaud DP-16QAM WDM Transmission

description.en: We demonstrate eleven-channel, 32/44-Gbaud DP-16QAM WDM transmission through a polarization-insensitive 8x8 silicon photonics switch with all ports cyclically connected, corresponding to 35.2-Tb/s throughput-per-switch, eight-stage cascaded operation. The wall-plug energy efficiency of the switch was 0.51pJ/bit. (C) 2018 The Authors(s)

publication_name.en: 2018 OPTICAL FIBER COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE AND EXPOSITION (OFC)

paper_title.en: Dynamic Routing of Y-00 Quantum Stream Cipher in Field-Deployed Dynamic Optical Path Network

description.en: Secure GbE communication by Y-00 protocol using noise masking for inter-datacenter connections is demonstrated in a dynamic optical path network testbed in Tokyo. We achieve dynamic path change with key re-synchronization between Y-00 cipher transceivers.

publication_name.en: 2018 OPTICAL FIBER COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE AND EXPOSITION (OFC)

paper_title.en: Demonstration of real-time path monitoring in optical switches

description.en: We demonstrate a novel method for monitoring internal paths of an optical switch exploiting light labeling technique. Using this method, the optical paths of a 4×4 optical fiber matrix switch could be monitored in 5ms without affecting the transmission performance.

publisher.en: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

publication_name.en: 2017 Opto-Electronics and Communications Conference, OECC 2017 and Photonics Global Conference, PGC 2017

paper_title.en: Real-time Path Monitoring of Optical Nodes

description.en: We demonstrate a novel method for monitoring internal paths of optical nodes exploiting light labeling technique. The optical paths of a 2x2 wavelength cross connect could be monitored in 2ms without affecting transmission performance.

publication_name.en: 2017 OPTICAL FIBER COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE AND EXHIBITION (OFC)

paper_title.en: Wavelength Translation of Dual-Polarization Phase-Modulated Nyquist OTDM at Terabit/s

description.en: Wavelength translation is one of the key functions to realize spectral defragmentation in an elastic optical add/drop network. Optically translating the wavelength of Terabit/s signals is challenging in the sense that it requires a signal processing scheme to be independent of the symbol rate and modulation format, wide-band, and highly efficient simultaneously. In this paper, we present an all-optical wavelength translation for a single-carrier 1.376Tb/s dual-polarization quadrature phase-shift keying (DP-QPSK) Nyquist optical time-division multiplexing (OTDM) signal by using an all-optical wavelength converter which fulfills all of the basic requirements. A seamless wavelength translation covering almost C-band is achieved with a boost in OSNR thanks to the improved conversion efficiency. The system performance is measured by a polarization-insensitive coherent receiver using linear sampling which implements simultaneously the demultiplexing of the time-domain tributaries, polarization demultiplexing, and carrier-phase recovery for the dual-polarization phase-modulated OTDM signal. The employed receiving scheme, therefore, resolves one of the most shortcomings of the conventional OTDM receiver, which is polarization sensitive due to the use of nonlinear sampling.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF LIGHTWAVE TECHNOLOGY

paper_title.en: Energy-efficient Dual-pump Degenerated Phase Sensitive Amplifiers

description.en: Dispersion effect in the dual-pump degenerated phase sensitive amplifiers has been investigated. More than 30-dB gain extinction ratio has been achieved at a nonlinear phase shift of only 0.73 rad by adjusting the fiber dispersion.

publication_name.en: 2016 21ST OPTOELECTRONICS AND COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE (OECC) HELD JOINTLY WITH 2016 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PHOTONICS IN SWITCHING (PS)

paper_title.en: Hybrid optical phase quantization for all-optical signal processing

description.en: Recent progress in all-optical signal processing based on the novel hybrid optical phase squeezer (HOPS) is presented. After reviewing the principle, we experimentally demonstrate various configurations of HOPS to phase-regenerate BPSK signal and QPSK signal. © 2015 OSA.

publication_name.en: Asia Communications and Photonics Conference, ACPC 2015

paper_title.en: Quadrature Squeezing and IQ De-Multiplexing of QPSK Signals by Sideband-Assisted Dual-Pump Phase Sensitive Amplifiers

description.en: High gain extinction ratio and stable control of the phase in phase sensitive amplification are fundamental to realize either phase regeneration or quadrature squeezing of phase modulated signals in an efficient and robust manner. In this paper, we show that a combination of our previously demonstrated "sideband-assisted" dual-pump phase sensitive amplifier with a gain extinction ratio of more than 25 dB, and a phase-locked loop based stabilization technique, enable efficient QPSK quadrature squeezing. Its stable operation is exploited to realize phase de-multiplexing of QPSK signals into BPSK tributaries. The phase de-multiplexed signals are evaluated through measurement of constellation diagrams, eye diagrams and more importantly, BER curves. The de-multiplexed BPSK signals exhibited an OSNR penalty of less than 1 dB compared to the back-to-back BPSK signals.

publication_name.en: IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS

paper_title.en: Signal phase regeneration through multiple wave coherent addition enabled by hybrid optical phase squeezer

description.en: A newly proposed concept, which is called hybrid optical phase squeezer (HOPS), achieves multi-level optical phase quantization through coherent addition of two (dual-wave scheme) or three (triple-wave scheme) optical waves exploiting optical parametric processes and electro-optic modulation. The triple-wave scheme enables signal phase regeneration free from phase-to-amplitude noise transfer, which is inevitable in the dual-wave scheme. By using HOPS in the dual-wave scheme, 3-fold phase-noise reduction was achieved for 24-Gb/s QPSK signals with a slight increase of amplitude noise. On the other hand, HOPS in the triple-wave scheme allowed phase regeneration of 12-Gb/s BPSK signal with a suppression of phase-to-amplitude noise transfer. (C) 2015 Optical Society of America

publication_name.en: OPTICS EXPRESS

paper_title.ja: Extremely High-capacity, Low-energy, and Low Latency Optical Networking for Future Infrastructure
paper_title.en: Extremely High-capacity, Low-energy, and Low Latency Optical Networking for Future Infrastructure

description.ja: Optical switching technologies have been attracting much attention because of the potential to save the cost and energy consumption. However, optical switching technologies have not been extensively used in the networks so far, while optical transmission technologies have been deployed widely. This paper figures out that the energy consumption of communication networks is going to rapidly increase with a continuous traffic increase. Then the “Dynamic Optical Path Network (DOPN)” is introduced to resolve the energy and capacity crunches in future by fully taking advantage of optical switching technologies. DOPN transfers data at an extremely low latency set only by the propagation delay of lightwave through optical fibers and switches, which enables future telepresence applications with ultra-high quality images. Its actual demonstration will also be reported.
description.en: Optical switching technologies have been attracting much attention because of the potential to save the cost and energy consumption. However, optical switching technologies have not been extensively used in the networks so far, while optical transmission technologies have been deployed widely. This paper figures out that the energy consumption of communication networks is going to rapidly increase with a continuous traffic increase. Then the “Dynamic Optical Path Network (DOPN)” is introduced to resolve the energy and capacity crunches in future by fully taking advantage of optical switching technologies. DOPN transfers data at an extremely low latency set only by the propagation delay of lightwave through optical fibers and switches, which enables future telepresence applications with ultra-high quality images. Its actual demonstration will also be reported.

publication_name.en: Proceedings of OECC 2015

paper_title.en: Optical Nyquist Filtering for Elastic OTDM Signals: Fundamentals and Demonstrations

description.en: Optical Nyquist filtering offers an efficient method to generate ultra-high speed optical time division multiplexing (OTDM) signals with bandwidth equal to the symbol rate without intersymbol interference. Since the Nyquist filtering can be simply implemented in a passive optical device such as a liquid crystal on silicon-based switching element, optical Nyquist filtering is potentially advantageous over digital filtering method in terms of energy efficiency and capacity. Especially in extremely coarse granular optical networks based on high baud rate Nyquist-OTDM signals, it would offer better spectral efficiency and elasticity through efficient add/drop multiplexing with small guard band and flexibility in bandwidth allocation. In this paper, we will discuss important roles of the optical Nyquist filtering as a platform to realize ultra-coarse granular elastic networks based on wavelength division multiplexing of Nyquist OTDM signals. While concepts of basic building blocks, such as elastic multi-Tbit/s transceiver and add/drop multiplexing, are presented, we will introduce proof-of-concept experimental demonstrations placing emphasis on the elasticity and the network aspect operations. We will also argue that spectral defragmentation is a critical network functionality at elastic add/drop nodes to improve the spectral utilization, and the realization of the spectral defragmentation by means of an all-optical wavelength converter is superior to the optical-electrical/electrical-optical approach thanks to the modulation format independent property of the employed optical parametric processes.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF LIGHTWAVE TECHNOLOGY

paper_title.en: First Demonstration of Wavelength Translation for 1.376-Tbit/s DP-QPSK Nyquist OTDM Signal

description.en: Seamless wavelength translation of a single-carrier 1.376-Tbit/s DP-QPSK Nyquist OTDM signal over similar to 30nm range is successfully demonstrated. Polarization-insensitive coherent detection using linear sampling is employed to demodulate dual-polarization Nyquist-OTDM signal for the first time.

publication_name.en: 2015 OPTICAL FIBER COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE AND EXHIBITION (OFC)

paper_title.en: Field transmission of uncompressed ultra-high definition video signals through dynamic optical path network

description.en: We demonstrate, for the first time, transmission of 86-Gb/s ultra-high definition video signals from Tokyo to Tsukuba over 173 km. Successful operation was confirmed through bit-error-rate < 10(-9) and noise-free videos displayed on the screen.

publication_name.en: 2015 OPTICAL FIBER COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE AND EXHIBITION (OFC)

paper_title.en: Field Transmission of an Uncompressed 8K Ultra-High Definition Television Optical Signal with Forward Error Correction Codes

description.en: We developed a transmission system that applies an FEC coding scheme to an uncompressed 72-Gb/s 8K UHDTV optical signal. Stable optical transmission of the 8K image is successfully demonstrated in a 173-km field fiber experiment.

publication_name.en: 2015 OPTO-ELECTRONICS AND COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE (OECC)

paper_title.en: Phase Regeneration of QPSK signals by Hybrid Optical Phase Squeezer

description.en: We demonstrate phase regeneration of 24-Gb/s QPSK signals using hybrid optical phase squeezer. Heavily phase-noise loaded signals experienced a more than 3-fold phase-noise decrease. A quality factor enhancement by more than 3dB is also demonstrated.

publication_name.en: 2015 OPTO-ELECTRONICS AND COMMUNICATIONS CONFERENCE (OECC)

paper_title.ja: What is the True Value of Dynamic Optical Path Switching?
paper_title.en: What is the True Value of Dynamic Optical Path Switching?

publication_name.en: 2015 Opto-Electronics and Communications Conference (Oecc)

paper_title.en: Phase regeneration of phase encoded signals by hybrid optical phase squeezer

description.en: We present a new method to perform phase regeneration of phase encoded signals. In our concept called "hybrid optical phase squeezer (HOPS)," a multilevel phase-quantized signal is synthesized through the coherent addition of a phase-conjugate copy of the signal and a phase harmonic of the signal with a frequency shifter. Unlike the conventional method by phase sensitive amplification, HOPS does not use any optical parametric gain such that only optical elements with low optical nonlinearity are necessary for optical phase quantization. In the proof-of-concept experiment, it is confirmed that a 2-level HOPS can perform quadrature squeezing with an extinction ratio of 40 dB. Simultaneous phase regeneration of two coherent wavelength-division-multiplexed 10.75-Gb/s binary phase-shift keyed signals is successfully demonstrated using a 2-level HOPS based on a semiconductor optical amplifier. (C) 2014 Optical Society of America

publication_name.en: OPTICS EXPRESS

paper_title.en: Optical-Time-Division Demultiplexing of 172 Gb/s to 43 Gb/s in a-Si:H Waveguides

description.en: We demonstrate optical-time-division demultiplexing of 172-43 Gb/s based on degenerate four-wave mixing in a 17-mm-long hydrogenated amorphous silicon (a-Si:H) wire waveguide. The a-Si:H wire waveguide has a record-low propagation loss of 1.0 dB/cm and a low two-photon-absorption loss of 0.2 cm/GW, and the nonlinear figure of merit is estimated to be 0.97, which is more than twice as effective as conventional crystalline silicon wire waveguides. We achieved successful error-free demultiplexing with an ON/OFF conversion efficiency of -10 dB and a power penalty of only 1.1 dB at a bit error rate of 10(-9). No optical damage to the a-Si:H waveguide was observed even after a continuous pump injection at an average power of several tens of mW for a couple of hours.

paper_title.ja: 位相感応型光増幅器を用いたQPSK信号の直交位相成分分離 (光通信システム)
paper_title.en: Phase de-multiplexing of QPSK signals by phase sensitive amplification

description.ja: 位相感応型光増幅器(PSA)は低分散非線形光ファイバーを非線形光学媒質に利用した場合、比較的低パワーのポンプ光を用いて光信号の直交位相成分を>25dB以上の高い利得消光比(GER)でスクイージングすることができる。この方法はSideband-Assisted PSA(SA-PSA)と呼ばれ位相変調信号の位相再生やフォーマット変換等の全光信号処理に利用できるが、その為にはポンプ光と信号光の相対位相を正確に制御することが重要になる。本稿ではSA-PSAを用いてQPSKを直交位相成分からなる2つのBPSKに分離する技術について報告する.
description.en: Phase sensitive amplification (PSA) based on low-dispersion highly nonlinear fiber allows performing quadrature squeezing with gain extinction ration of >25dB using low pump power. This method, which we call side-band assisted PSA (SA-PSA), can be used to perform phase regeneration or format transformation of phase modulated signals provide that relative phase between the signal and pumps are accurately controlled. We report a new technology based on SA-PSA to demultiplex a QPSK signal into two BPSK signals carrying the orthogonal phase components.

paper_title.ja: 光パラメトリック遅延分散制御の広帯域動作
paper_title.en: Wideband operation of optical parametric delay dispersion tuner

description.ja: 光信号の遅延制御は汎用性が高く、光ネットワークに限らずフェーズアレー技術や超大出力レーザ領域など、さまざまな応用が考えられる。いわゆる遅い光も、光の遅延制御という汎用的な応用に向けて基礎研究がさまざま研究グループによって進められた。しかしながら、光信号、特に光通信での高速光信号は帯域が広いため、光の遅延制御でも十分な動作帯域を確保することが不可欠となってくる。遅い光は、Kramers-Kronigの関係を動作原理としており、広い帯域を得るためには遅延幅を犠牲にせざるを得ないという致命的な問題がある。その点、パラメトリック過程を利用した連続光遅延制御方式(パラメトリック遅延)では、信号帯域は遅延量に関係なく広く設計可能であり、高速光信号を扱うのに適している。本報告では、パラメトリック遅延の動作原理を紹介した後、動作の制限要因について言及する。その後、筆者らが提案する新しい遅延方式である光パラメトリック遅延分散制御方式を紹介し、本技術では遅延と分散を広帯域に亘り同時に且つ独立に均一制御できることについて言及する。さらに、原理実証において、43Gbpsピコ秒パルスが、波形ひずみも伝送エラーも無く1THzの帯域に亘って均一に22nsまで連続に遅延することを示す。
description.en: Optical variable delay lines find many applications in many fields, not only in telecom areas but also in phased array technologies, high-power laser physics and so forth. The so-called 'slow light' has been extensively studied for such motivations. However, the fundamental trade-off of the slow light between bandwidth and delay, stemming from the Kramers-Kronig relation, is crucial particularly for telecom applications in which most of the signals have a wide band. The parametric delay, on the other hand, intrinsically free from the Kramers-Kronig trade-off, is capable of providing a wide operating bandwidth while delay can be truly continuous and large at the same time. In this paper, after a brief introduction of the operating principle of parametric delay, we point out what limits the delay range. Then, we refer to the operating principle of what we recently proposed as 'Parametric Delay Dispersion Tuner (PDDT)', and show how it is capable of overcoming the limit of the conventional parametric delays. Finally, we will show through a proof-of-principle experiment that PDDT can achieve a uniform delay of picosecond pulses over 22ns for a 1THz signal pass band with error-free transmissions at 43Gbps.

paper_title.en: Numerical simulation of distributed cavity phase shift in atomic fountain frequency standard

description.en: The spatial phase variations in feeding a microwave cavity with asymmetrical amplitudes and phases were calculated using the finite element method (FEM) that was applied to the three-dimensional (3D) model of the microwave cavity developed at the National Metrology Institute of Japan (NMIJ)/AIST. The distributed cavity phase shift (DCPS) in an atomic fountain frequency standard was calculated for atomic interaction with the position-dependent amplitudes and phases inside the cavity. The tolerances of asymmetry in the phases and amplitudes of microwaves were determined in order to achieve an uncertainty of 5 x 10(-16) with respect to the DCPS.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS BRIEF COMMUNICATIONS & REVIEW PAPERS

paper_title.en: Preliminary evaluation of the cs atomic fountain frequency standard at NMIJ/AIST

description.en: With the aim of contributing to the calibration of the International Atomic Time Scale (TAI), a cesium atomic fountain frequency standard is developed at the National Metrology Institute of Japan. The short-term stability is measured to be sigma(tau) = 4.7 x 10(-13) x tau(-1/2) by comparison with a hydrogen maser. Preliminary results of the accuracy evaluation, including measurement of the second-order Zeeman shift, are presented.

paper_title.en: Frequency measurements and hyperfine structure of the R(85)33-0 transition of molecular iodine with a femtosecond optical comb

description.en: Absolute frequency measurements of the R(85)33-0 transition of molecular iodine at the blue end of the tuning range of a frequency-doubled Nd:YAG laser are implemented with a femtosecond optical comb based on a mode-locked Ti:sapphire laser. The hyperfine structure of the R(85)33-0 transition is observed by use of high-resolution laser spectroscopy and is measured by the femtosecond optical comb. The observed hyperfine transitions are good frequency references for both frequency-doubled Nd:YAG and Nd:YVO4 lasers in the 532-nm region. High-accuracy hyperfine constants are obtained by our fitting the measured hyperfine splittings to a four-term Hamiltonian, which includes the electric quadrupole, spin-rotation, tensor spin-spin, and scalar spin-spin interactions. (C) 2004 Optical Society of America.

paper_title.en: Development of an intensity stabilized laser system with frequency offset of 9.2 GHz

description.en: We have developed a laser system for use in the velocity selection of cesium atoms through stimulated Raman transition. The laser system consisted of two phase-locked extended-cavity diode lasers with a frequency offset of 9.2 GHz, whose intensity was also stabilized using an acoustooptic modulator. The power concentration and the intensity stability were 93% and 0.1%, respectively.

paper_title.en: Measurement of a weak magnetic field using cold atoms

description.en: Laser-cooled atoms were utilized to precisely measure a weak magnetic field. The technique is based on the linear Zeeman shift of the hyperfine transition of cesium atom and allows high-resolution measurement in the presence of a field gradient. The method was applied to evaluate the C-field of an atomic fountain frequency standard. in which a field-sensitive transition was probed by Ramsey resonance. The relationship between the measurement time and the resolution is also discussed.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS

academic_society_name.en: The Japan Society of Applied Physics

research_project_title.ja: セシウム原子泉周波数標準器の開発
